com.ibm.gaiandb.apps

Class MetricMonitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.gaiandb.apps.MetricMonitor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class MetricMonitor
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The metric monitor adds self-monitoring facilities to GaianDB. It creates a logical table called GDB_METRICS (which should not be used by other sources). Anyone can add a monitor by creating an object which implements MetricMonitor.Monitor<T> and adding it to the singleton object retrieved through the getInstance method.
    Author:
    Samir Talwar - stalwar@uk.ibm.com
    See Also:
    MetricMonitor.Monitor, getInstance(java.sql.Connection)

      • getInstance

        public static MetricMonitor getInstance(java.sql.Connection conn)
        Retrieves an instance of MetricMonitor corresponding to the given connection. If one does not exist, it creates one and starts it.
        Parameters:
        conn - The database connection.
        Returns:
        A new or existing MetricMonitor.

      • run

        public void run()
        Creates the physical and logical tables, and starts inserting data using the list of monitors.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the monitor.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Informs the caller whether the monitor is still running.
        Returns:
        True if the monitor is running, or false if it is not.

      • addJVMMonitors

        public void addJVMMonitors()
        Adds monitors that record JVM metrics.

      • addMonitor

        public <T> void addMonitor(java.lang.String name,
                           MetricMonitor.Monitor<T> monitor)
        Adds a monitor to the list. The name provided will be used when inserting data into the table. If a monitor with the same name is provided, it will be overwritten.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The monitor type.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the monitor. Maximum length is 32 characters. A longer name will be truncated.
        monitor - The monitor itself.

      • removeMonitor

        public void removeMonitor(java.lang.String name)
        Removes a monitor with the given name from the list.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the monitor. Maximum length is 32 characters. A longer name will be truncated.
